name: Arguelles, Randolf L.
title: College Counseling Director / VP
notes: Randolf Arguelles is a San Francisco-based education professional and 20+ year veteran in college admissions. He served as Branch Director of Elite Prep San Francisco for 15 years and later became Co-Director of College Counseling at Drew School; he also served as an external reader of freshman applications to UC Berkeley for seven application cycles.
ngos: Chair of the Personnel Committee for a San Francisco organization supporting the African American community for over 100 years (identity not publicly named)

name: Ashby, Peter R.
title: Founder
notes: Peter Ashby is a San Francisco-based investment management professional with 18+ years of C-level experience in operations, capital raising, risk management, and compliance. He previously served as COO/CCO for MIG Capital (a $1B equity hedge fund) and held prior roles at Bocage Capital, RS Investments, and Lincoln Property Company.

name: Barbatelli, Ettore Jr.
title: Founder/Chairman (retired)
notes: Ettore Barbatelli Sr. founded Valuation Research Corporation in Milwaukee, WI in 1974 and served as President or Chairman for 21 years; he was a former CEO of American Appraisal Company. Ettore Barbatelli Jr. is noted as retired and based in California; limited separate public profile from his father exists.

name: Barton, Greg
title: Unknown
notes: Multiple individuals named Greg Barton exist in California technology and finance; the specific Bohemian Grove member could not be conclusively identified from public records. Candidates include a Redwood City-based technology sales executive with experience at Oracle and Salesforce.

name: Carlson, Donald W.
title: Senior Founding Partner (retired)
notes: Donald W. Carlson is an internationally recognized San Francisco trial lawyer and senior founding partner of Carlson, Calladine & Peterson LLP. He has been a Northern California Super Lawyer every year since 2004 and retired effective 12/31/2022, now splitting time between Maui and San Francisco.
ngos: Founding Circle member, B612 Foundation (nonprofit dedicated to planetary defense against asteroid impacts)

name: D'Ovidio, Gene J.
title: Senior VP, Business Integration & Strategy (former) / Board Member
notes: Gene D'Ovidio is a deeply experienced management consultant with nearly 30 years in retail, media, and technology. He served as Senior VP at Restoration Hardware and previously founded Intellectual Capital Partners consulting firm; he is based in San Francisco and received the 2024 AARP Andrus Award for Community Service in California.
ngos: Board Member, Music in Place (501c3 nonprofit); also involved with A Meal with Dignity (homelessness/hunger nonprofit)

name: Donahoe, Daniel J. IV
title: Unknown
notes: Daniel J. Donahoe IV could not be conclusively identified from public records. California Bar search returns a Daniel Donahoe Wall (#311391) as a San Francisco attorney, but no confirmed match for the specific 'IV' suffix was found.

name: Draper, Timothy C.
title: Founder and Managing Partner
notes: Timothy Cook Draper (born June 11, 1958) is a prominent Silicon Valley venture capital investor and founder of Draper Fisher Jurvetson (DFJ), Draper University, and Draper Associates. He holds a BS in electrical engineering from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard Business School; notable investments include Baidu, Hotmail, Skype, Tesla, SpaceX, and Coinbase.
ngos: Founded BizWorld (nonprofit teaching entrepreneurship to children) and Innovate Your State; served on California State Board of Education; member of Singapore International Economic Council
political_donations: Donated to both Kamala Harris and Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaigns in roughly equal amounts (~$1M total); also donated to California ballot initiatives on school vouchers and state-splitting proposals

name: Edwards, Cree A.
title: Co-Founder and CEO
notes: Cree Edwards co-founded eMeter Corporation in 1999 and served as its CEO; eMeter provides energy information management software for utilities and is headquartered in San Mateo, CA. He also co-founded CellNet Data Systems in 1984 (acquired by Landis+Gyr in 2006) and has a residence in Woodside, California.

name: Edwards, Paul C
title: Unknown
notes: Paul C. Edwards could not be conclusively identified from public records. Multiple Paul Edwards executives exist in California finance and technology; without a middle name confirmation or employer detail, a specific match could not be made.

name: Edwards, William L.
title: Unknown
notes: William L. Edwards could not be conclusively identified from public records. Multiple William Edwards professionals and attorneys exist in California but without additional identifying details a specific match could not be confirmed.

name: Ellis, James Fancher
title: Co-Founder and Managing Principal
notes: James F. 'Jim' Ellis is co-founder of Ellis Partners, a privately-owned commercial real estate investment and development company founded in San Francisco in 1993. Ellis Partners has invested in over 60 projects throughout Northern California with assets valued over $2.5 billion; Jim began his career at Koll Development Company.
ngos: Past President of Berkeley Real Estate Associates; board member of SF Bay Area Chapter of NAIOP; member of Lambda Alpha Land Economics Honor Society; member of Urban Land Institute

name: Evers, Williamson M.
employer: Hoover Institution, Stanford University / Independent Institute
title: Research Fellow
notes: Williamson M. 'Bill' Evers (born October 18, 1948) is an education researcher and former libertarian activist, now a research fellow at the Hoover Institution's Koret Task Force on K-12 Education. He served as US Assistant Secretary of Education for Planning, Evaluation and Policy Development under President George W. Bush (2007-2009) and was named to Donald Trump's 2016 education transition team.
ngos: Hoover Institution Koret Task Force on K-12 Education; Independent Institute research fellow
political_donations: Former Libertarian Party congressional candidate (1980); served as Bush (2000, 2004), McCain (2008), and Romney (2012) campaign adviser; named to Trump 2016 transition team

name: Fowler, Gregory A.
title: Founder and Managing Partner
notes: Gregory A. Fowler is founder and managing partner of FPA Multifamily, a Santa Barbara-based real estate investment firm with over 40 years of experience and approximately $24 billion in total transactions involving 770+ apartment communities. He holds a degree from the University of California, San Diego.

name: Gotcher, Peter C.
title: Chairman of the Board (Dolby); Independent Director (GoPro)
notes: Peter Gotcher founded Digidesign in 1984 (sold to Avid Technology in 1995) and won a Grammy (2000) and Oscar (2004) for Technical Achievement. He joined Dolby's board in 2003 and has served as Chairman; he also serves on GoPro's board and previously was a Venture Partner at Institutional Venture Partners and Redpoint Ventures.
ngos: Trustee, Berklee College of Music; board member, Santa Clara University (elected 2016)

name: Harman, Fred
title: Managing Partner
notes: Fred Harman joined Oak Investment Partners as a General Partner in 1994, focusing on Consumer Internet and Internet New Media investments. Prior to Oak he spent seven years with Morgan Stanley's Venture Capital Group as a General Partner; he received an MBA from Harvard and BS/MS in Electrical Engineering from Stanford.
ngos: Board of Directors, Stanford Hospital; Trustee, Sacred Heart Schools; Trustee, US Ski and Snowboard Team Foundation; co-owner Golden State Warriors

name: Henderson, Mark W.
title: Unknown
notes: Mark W. Henderson could not be conclusively identified from public records. Multiple Mark Henderson attorneys and executives exist in California; without additional identifying information, a specific match could not be confirmed.

name: Horn, William G.
title: Unknown
notes: William G. Horn could not be conclusively identified from public records. A William L. Horn is a securities attorney in California, but the middle initial 'G.' did not match any prominent Bay Area executive in available public records.

name: Isola, Frank J. Jr.
title: President
notes: Frank J. Isola Jr. is based in Los Altos Hills, California, and has served as President of Isola Corporation with prior experience at Franklin Templeton Investor Services. A 2010 charitable remainder trust (EIN 27-6951156) in his name was registered in Los Altos Hills, CA.

name: Jackson, Mike R.
title: Managing Partner
notes: Mike Jackson is a Silicon Valley-based climate tech investor who spent 15 years as an entrepreneur and VC. He rose to partner at the Westly Group (a $400M+ cleantech VC firm) and then founded Earthshot Ventures, which invests in seed and Series A climate tech startups. He previously co-founded Village Green Energy and was a Stanford energy policy researcher.

name: Johnson, Larsh M.
title: Chief Technology Officer
notes: Larsh M. Johnson is CTO of Stem, Inc. (a clean energy storage company), which he joined in January 2016. He previously served as CTO at Siemens Digital Grid (acquired eMeter, which Johnson co-founded in 1999) and earlier co-founded CellNet Data Systems in 1984. He holds BS and MS degrees in Mechanical Engineering from Stanford University.
ngos: Founding member, DOE Gridwise Architecture Council (GWAC), Member Emeritus; Board Member, Drop Water Corporation

name: Johnson, M. Carl III
employer: Nautilus, Inc. (board, retired) / Del Monte Foods (former)
title: Chairman of the Board (retired)
notes: M. Carl Johnson III is a consumer packaged goods veteran who held senior positions at Colgate-Palmolive, Kraft Foods, Campbell Soup Company, Del Monte Foods, and J.M. Smucker. He served as Chairman of the Board of Nautilus, Inc. from 2011 until retiring in August 2022, and briefly as interim CEO. He holds an MBA from the University of Chicago and a BA from Wesleyan University.
ngos: Advisory Board, Agricultural Sustainability Institute at UC Davis; Steering Committee, Kilts Center for Marketing at University of Chicago Booth School

name: Kepner, Scott D.
employer: Village Properties Operating Company, LLC / Village Investment Partners, LP
title: Managing Partner
notes: Scott D. Kepner has been managing partner of real estate and development partnerships under Village Properties Operating Company since 1985, based in Belmont, California. He graduated magna cum laude from Dartmouth College with an AB in Economics and received an MBA from Stanford GSB. In 2020 he was nominated as a director candidate in a proxy contest for Barnwell Industries, Inc. (SEC filing).

name: Larson, Lynn Iver
title: Unknown
notes: Lynn Iver Larson could not be conclusively identified from public records. The full name 'Lynn Iver Larson' did not surface in available professional databases or news sources; the name may reflect a California business or legal professional with limited public digital footprint.

name: Lynch, Charles R.
title: Chairman
notes: Charles A. Lynch is Chairman of Market Value Partners Company, a management, mentoring, and advisory firm for consumer-related businesses. He has served on the boards of over 20 major corporations including Pacific Life Insurance, Kaiser Aluminum, Crocker National Bank, Nordstrom, and W.R. Grace. He is based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
ngos: Former director, Bay Area Council; former chairman, California Business Roundtable; former chairman, Palo Alto Medical Foundation; former chairman, United Way of the Bay Area

name: Lynch, Ronald P. Jr.
title: Unknown

Lynch Foundation is registered as a nonprofit (EIN 13-6863977), and a Ronald Patrick Lynch Jr. appears on FINRA BrokerCheck having worked at multiple financial firms including Bear Stearns and Ameriprise Financial, but a California-based executive match was not confirmed.
ngos: Ronald P. & Susan E. Lynch Foundation (private foundation, EIN 13-6863977)

name: Millar, Richard W. Jr.
employer: Friedman Stroffe & Gerard (Of Counsel) / Millar, Hodges & Bemis (retired)
title: Of Counsel / Partner (retired)
notes: Richard W. Millar Jr. (CA Bar #39777) practiced litigation, business disputes, appellate law, probate, real estate, and legal malpractice with Millar, Hodges & Bemis in Newport Beach, CA from 1979 to 2017, becoming Of Counsel at Friedman Stroffe & Gerard thereafter. He served as Orange County Bar Association President in 2002.

name: Mohler, David G. M.D.
title: Clinical Professor; Chief, Musculoskeletal Tumor Service
notes: Dr. David G. Mohler is a board-certified orthopedic surgeon and Clinical Professor at Stanford University's Department of Orthopaedic Surgery, specializing in musculoskeletal tumors, metabolic bone disease, and reconstructive surgery. He earned his MD from Cornell University Medical College and completed fellowship training at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center; he practices in Redwood City, CA.

name: Munks, Greg
title: Sheriff (retired)
notes: Gregory 'Greg' Munks served as San Mateo County Sheriff for over 35 years, managing a $240M budget and 750 employees; he was first elected sheriff in 2006 and retired July 16, 2016 citing health reasons. He managed law enforcement services countywide including at San Francisco International Airport and oversaw a major correctional system overhaul.
ngos: Board of Directors, 100 Club of San Mateo County (support organization for families of fallen law enforcement)

name: O'Grady, Standish H.
title: Managing Director and Co-Founder
notes: Standish O'Grady co-founded Granite Ventures as the early-stage venture capital group within Hambrecht & Quist in 1992, and co-led Granite's spin-out as an independent firm in 1998, growing it to over $1 billion in funds under management. He focuses on software investments and is based in San Francisco (101 2nd Street, Suite 570). His SEC Form 4 filings at Anaplan confirm board directorship.

name: Roth, Douglas H.
title: Senior Vice President
notes: Douglas H. Roth is a Senior Vice President at Project Management Advisors, Inc., based in the San Francisco area. Multiple Douglas Roth professionals exist; the San Francisco-based profile at Project Management Advisors is the best match for a Bay Area executive context. Additional details are limited in public records.

name: Schulze, Mark Chapman
title: Co-Founder; VP Business Development
notes: Mark Schulze co-founded Clover Network (fintech POS platform) and served as its VP of Business Development; he also built the publisher business at Quantcast and ran Match.com for IAC, and managed groups at AOL and AltaVista/Intuit. He is an angel investor based in Mountain View, California.

name: Schumacher, Robert J.
title: Chief Executive / Principal
notes: Robert J. Schumacher is Chief Executive of Schumacher Interests, Inc., a Woodside, California-based investment firm with holdings in real estate and oil and gas exploration. He has been associated with twelve companies over a 26-year period; the firm is located at 2995 Woodside Road, Woodside, CA 94062.

name: Shiff, Stuart
title: Founder and Chief Executive Officer
notes: Stuart Shiff founded DivcoWest in 1993, a vertically integrated commercial real estate investment firm headquartered in San Francisco with over $16.2B in AUM as of recent data. He holds a BS in Civil Engineering from UC Berkeley and entered the SF Bay Area tech real estate market at its inception alongside leading technology companies.
ngos: UC Berkeley Executive Committee; Policy Advisory Board, Fisher Center for Real Estate & Urban Economics; UCSF Board of Overseers Real Estate Committee; Urban Land Institute; Pension Real Estate Association (PREA); established Mark Bingham Rugby Endowment at Cal Athletics

name: Stricklin, John
title: President and Chief Executive Officer
notes: John Stricklin has been a real estate designer, developer, investor, and builder based in San Francisco since 1989, with focus on land acquisition, entitlement, design, and development of apartment buildings and commercial properties in California and Hawaii. He is President and CEO of Peacock Properties, Inc. (incorporated January 19, 1995, at 601 Van Ness Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94102).
ngos: Board of Directors, Presidio Knolls School (San Francisco)
